description: Strengthening the National Institutional and Educational Capacity to Carry Out Official Development Assistance (ODA) Programmes and Projects (SNIECODA)

subproject.description: The project has two main components: 1) build national institutional capacity to carry put ODA programmes/projects in partner countries; 20 raise awareness at national level on Romanian ODA.
subproject.title: ODA Capacity Strengthening I

subproject.description: The project has two main components: 1) build national institutional capacity to carry put ODA programmes/projects in partner countries; 20 raise awareness at national level on Romanian ODA.
subproject.title: ODA Capacity Strengthening I

subproject.description: Strengthened capacity of the Romanian Non-Governmental Organizations for implementing ODA projects and programs, active and efficient involvement of the Romanian NGOs in organizing two major events which bring together all the important stakeholders in development cooperation field: civil society organizations, governmental actors, experts from European and international donors, partner countries, mass-media, academia and the private sector
subproject.title: NGO Capacity Development onODA

subproject.description: Strengthened capacity of the Romanian Non-Governmental Organizations for implementing ODA projects and programs, active and efficient involvement of the Romanian NGOs in organizing two major events which bring together all the important stakeholders in development cooperation field: civil society organizations, governmental actors, experts from European and international donors, partner countries, mass-media, academia and the private sector
subproject.title: NGO Capacity Development onODA

subproject.description: The UNDP will support the MFA in the implementation of a training programme in the field of reconstruction and development. The programme is intended to support post-conflict reconstruction and recovery efforts in the priority regions and countries of Romania’s international development cooperation policy. The programme implementation is part of the larger objective to set up the institutional framework of the Romanian Training Centre for Post-conflict Reconstruction that will ensure the sustainability of efforts in this area. The 5-day training programme targets practitioners of post-conflict recovery as well as civilian and military actors in recovery and reconstruction.
subproject.title: Conflict Prevention & Recovery

subproject.description: The UNDP will support the Ministry of Foreign Affairs to develop its capacity to implement ODA-funded projects. The programme is intended to support Romania’s efforts to become a lead donor of development assistance in the priority countries and regions of Romania’s international development cooperation policy. The programme implementation is also part of the larger objective to better define the niche areas in which Romanian ODA can be most effectively channelled and to set up the institutional framework of the Romanian Training Centre for Post-conflict Reconstruction that will ensure the sustainability of efforts in this area.
subproject.title: Support to ODA phase II

subproject.description: After joining the European Union in January 2007, Romania has changed its status from development assistance (DA) recipient to DA provider. In support of creating the knowledge, expertise and capacities that are necessary to undertake the new role, the current project aims to strengthen the capacity of the Romanian Non-Governmental Organizations for implementing ODA projects and programs and to reach an active and efficient involvement of the Romanian NGOs in organizing three major events which bring together all the important stakeholders in development cooperation field: civil society organizations, governmental actors, experts from European and international donors, partner countries, mass-media and the academia. The three events will encourage networking among the various actors in the area, fostering the development of joint projects and creating opportunities for transferring the Romanian expertise abroad.
subproject.title: NGO Capacity Development II

subproject.description: The UNDP will support the Ministry of Foreign Affairs to develop its capacity to implement ODA-funded projects. The programme is intended to support Romania’s efforts to become a lead donor of development assistance in the priority countries and regions of Romania’s international development cooperation policy.
subproject.gender code: Gender equality as a significant objective
subproject.title: Support to ODA Phase III

title: Strengthen Capacity to Carry out ODA Programmes
